result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon Michael Herritz in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Brandon Michael Herritz.  Atty Masana believes matter is close to resolution but has not yet had a preliminary hearing.  DE will be going to inpatient tomorrow.  Requests plea and sentence with prelim waiver in about 30-60 days.  Matter reset.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Absolute Sobriety; Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.

2:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess  and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon Michael Herritz appeared by video, in custody from LEC with Atty. Markoski. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney. DE qualifies for PD representation. State requests $100 CASH Bond.  Atty. Markoski has no objection to conditions but requests signature.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute Sobriety.  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription. If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
